result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Detavion J Hawthorne

defendant.name: Hawthorne, Detavion J
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Order for Substitution of Attorneys, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 14, 2022
Proposed Order for Substitution of Attorneys, filed by Atty. Cotton

10:43 AM Defendant Detavion J Hawthorne in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Detavion J Hawthorne.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court notes the defendant submitted an inmate communication to Judge Bohren requesting a bail reduction which was directed to this Court for today's hearing.  
Attorney Gutierrez did not know this would be allowed to be addressed today or he would have filed a formal motion to be heard and states they would be ready to proceed as to the motion to reduce cash bail.  
Attorney Will states she would be prepared to address the motion but does note the typical practice is for cash bail modifications are to be sent to the trial court.
As this was directed by the Trial Court to address the motion at today's date, the Court proceed and address the request for a modification as the parties are prepared to proceed.
Attorney Gutierrez requests a downward modification to cash bail and presents arguments.  
State objects to any modification to cash bail and presents arguments.
Response argument by Attorney Gutierrez.  
For all the reasons stated on the record, the Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail. 
Bail remains as fixed. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to a preliminary hearing and the Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Brandon Pipp of the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated September 22, 2022 asking for a bail reduction.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 30, 2022 - Have Commissioner review.**

Search Warrant Executed on 09-21-2022. Red, Black, White, and White iPhone. 

Order Granting Warrant for records of communications or other information held by a provider of electronic communications services and/or remote computing services;
Request for Warrant
Warrant for Content
Affidavit
Return of Warrant
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

2:03 PM Defendant Detavion J Hawthorne in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Detavion J Hawthorne. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
